comments:
Steps to reproduce:
1) Rename a filter set from the profiling filters page in the Edit Profiling 
Set dialog (e.g., change 'Default' to 'Default Test').  Do not click any filter 
set after dismissing Edit Filter Set Dialog.
- note the TraceProfileFiltersUI._filterSetList is correctly updated after 
dismissing the Edit Filter Set dialog but the TraceProfileFiltersUI.activeFS 
member still has the previous name.

2) Click the Back button.
-  this triggers the TraceProfileOverviewUI.performApply
(ProfilingSetsManagerCopy copy) method to be called which executes the 
following statements
	String name = _filterTab.getActiveFilterSet();				
	// returns previous name 'Default' (expected 'Default Test')
	copy.setDefaultFilterSet((FilterSetElement)copy.getFilterSets().get
(name));	// results in null DefaultFilterSet since old name not found

3) Click the Next button - the filters page is not displayed due to following 
error:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java)
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java)
	at java.lang.NullPointerException.<init>(NullPointerException.java:60)
	at 
org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.core.TraceProfileFiltersUI.setActiveFilterS
et(TraceProfileFiltersUI.java:1567)
	at 
org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.launcher.ProfileFiltersTab.activateFilters
(ProfileFiltersTab.java:83)
	at 
org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.core.TraceProfileOverviewUI$EditWizardPage2
.initializeFrom(TraceProfileOverviewUI.java:518)
	at 
org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.core.TraceProfileOverviewUI$EditWizardDialo
g.nextPressed(TraceProfileOverviewUI.java:424)
	at org.eclipse.jface.wizard.WizardDialog.buttonPressed
(WizardDialog.java:300)

Builds Used:
